conversation.content: Um, hi, I just, uh, signed up for your loyalty thing and, er, I'm trying to understand the terms?
Oh yeah, the—let me just—okay so the VIP Rewards program, member ID VRP-8847-QN, and honestly? The terms are a bit—I mean, they're ridiculous, even I think so.
Right, um, so like, what happens with my points if I, uh, don't use them?
So they expire—wait no, sorry—they used to expire after 6 months but now it's—let me check—code POL-2024-EXP shows 12 months, which is still kinda short if you ask me.
Um, okay, that's, er, better than I thought, but uh, what about returns?
Yeah so, um, this is where it gets—I mean, honestly annoying—if you return something, um, the points get deducted from account PTS-BALANCE-01, and uh, if you already used them? They charge you.
They charge me? Um, that seems, uh, I mean next time I'll just, er, not bother with points then.
Right? It's—look, between us—total nonsense. The system ref TRM-SECTION-7B makes it so complicated when it should just be simple.
Well, um, at least you're being honest about it, uh, I appreciate that.
So here's what I—actually wait—let me tell you the workaround, um, if you use code SAVE-POINTS-90 when redeeming, uh, it protects them for returns, but they don't advertise this.
Um, really? That's, uh, actually helpful, er, thanks for telling me.
Yeah the whole—I mean—document DOC-LOYALTY-2024 is 47 pages long, who reads that? So um, anything else that's, uh, confusing you about it?
Er, what about, um, the birthday rewards thing, uh, how does that work exactly?
Oh that's actually—wait, let me—yeah so code BDAY-BONUS-200 gives double points, but here's the dumb part, you gotta activate it yourself, it's not automatic.
Um, of course it's not automatic, uh, why would anything just, er, work simply?
I know—it's like—we have your birthdate in file DOB-FIELD-ACTIVE, the system knows, but no, you still gotta manually click the button, it's so backwards.
Well, um, at least now I know, uh, better than finding out after missing it.
Exactly, and um, while we're at it—the tier system? Code TIER-SILVER-500, uh, you need 500 points for Silver but they don't—I mean, the benefits are barely different from basic.
Um, good to know, er, I'll just, uh, not stress about reaching tiers then.
Smart move, honestly just, um, use the points for discounts—code DISC-APPLY-10—and uh, don't overthink the rest, that's what I tell everyone who actually listens.
